title.narrative: National NGO Strategy on Torture Treatment

description.narrative:
The first day of the conference will aim to share, in a large roundtable manner, past and present experiences working with torture victims, and give an in-depth analysis and view of the more effective interventions, and what have proven to be best and worst practices. This, with the aim of identifying evidence-based, culturally appropriate best practices in Colombia in the torture treatment field.
The second day the participants would separate into selected groups, ensuring there is at least one member from public institutions in each group, to discuss the key issues mentioned above in section 2.
The end of the second day would be a summary of what each group discussed that morning, and the development of a work plan for the year 2015 to define how to proceed with each topic.

The primary goal of the conference is to foster greater coordination, communication and programming design collaboration between the Government of Colombia, post Ley de Víctimas, representatives from the local health authorities (departmental, district and municipal secretarías de salud) and the Colombian torture treatment community. The secondary goal of the conference is to permit exchange of best practices in torture treatment, specifically designed and tested in the Colombian context.
